name: Sheraton Harborside Hotel Portsmouth

reviews.title: Happy with Stay
reviews.text: My family decided to go away for a few days the week of Chirstmas break, just for a few days to get away. We have three children, 7, 5, and 2. We decided to stay at the Sheraton, b/c it is close to Kittery and it is close to the water...not like we were swimming, but we are New England ocean people, even in the winter. Anyway, the rates we received were a great value for the hotel. We paid about a $100 a night, and we've stayed in other hotels for more money that weren't nearly as nice as this place.
Pros? Bed was fabulous, room was clean, clean, clean. Service was fantastic. Cute shops/restaurants. Close to kittery outlets!
reviews.title: Had a good stay

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for my future sister-in-law's wedding. I had never been to Portsmouth, and upon arrival, I thought the view and location were perfect for the nautical theme of the occasion. The hotel is in a perfect location to downtown Portsmouth. The lobby, restaurant, and banquet rooms are spacious and inviting. Views of the water can be seen from the hotel and are beautiful. The hotel is an odd shape, so it was a little challenging to find the rooms. Also, the suites have a private entrance to the hallway, which is a nice touch if you are paying the money, but when you are in a wedding party, it is a major pain. People had to go to the front desk to be admitted to the private elevator, and the same staff, though they saw me 15 times in one day, continued to ask for my ID for "security" reasons. The rooms are very small, and somewhat outdated unless you are staying on the 4th floor. I could have sworn that my room was a smoking room, but the hotel is a non-smoking hotel. Perhaps it was recently converted. Also, beware if you have a waterfront view. The sunrise, though incredible, will awaken you at 5am. Also, some of the wedding party had a parking lot light shining through the room the entire night. Just figure out how to close the curtains if you can, and you'll be fine. I am being very picky in this review, but I feel that people have a right to know the details of what they are getting into. For the occasion, the hotel was ideal in terms of location, wedding, cost, and convenience to the activities downtown. Just know that this hotel is obviously a little older, and might need some updates here and there. Also, if you are interested in working out, there is a gym downstairs with one treadmill, bike, and efx each, and a weight system. Finally, there is no convenient store within walking distance but a small one located at the front desk in the lobby, and vending machines downstairs. I definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay in downtown Portsmouth. As well, it made for a beautiful wedding reception location.
reviews.title: Sheraton Portsmouth - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm planning another trip through the area so I checked out this place on Tripadvisor. It reminded me that I stayed here back in 2003 for one night on the club level. All the reviews here are absolutely accurate.
reviews.title: What a shame.

reviews.text: The front desk 'experience' was like the twilight zone, unfriendly, like a deposition the two clerks answered only specific questions, it was like pulling teeth. The club floor club lounge was very small and luckily we caught the guy setting up, he had one tray of warm munchies and a small selection of drinks. We skipped in favor of dinner.
reviews.title: Just a veneer

reviews.text: The room was ok, it had a view over the central parking area to the water.
reviews.title: a little rough
nice hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast in the bar was another surreal experience, the server was in her own little world and we had to track her down for everything, and we were the only ones having breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in October. Reasonable enough, but not perfect. Hotel was very clean, and in a great location which earns it some extra marks. We were upgraded to a Club room, which seemed nice enough but not exceptional. Downside of this was we had to use 'the slowest lift in the world!'(tm) to get to our romm. Waiting was like water torture. Also, we were given dubious instructions about breakfast, and ended up charged $40+ that we shouldn't have been. This was scrubbed from our bill but has just re-appeared on my credit-card statement. Very sneaky...
reviews.title: Fine - nothing exceptional though!

likes.disliked: — Slowest lift in the world, sneaky charges to credit card...

reviews.text: This property is wonderful. Staff was exceptional and the location can not be beat.
reviews.title: Will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel just recently converted to non smoking. Our room smelled like smoke. The front desk offered us another room. That room also smelled a bit like smoke . We chose to have them spray our original room since we were only staying for one night. That night a voucher for 4 people for breakfast was left under our door.
